p: Knowledge of the course of HEV infection is based mainly on two volunteer studies [ 13, 14] and three patient studies [ 15– 17]. The two single volunteer studies (with known dates of exposure) gave incubation periods of 38 and 39 days respectively [ 13, 14]. Clinical illness typically lasts 1–4 weeks [ 17]. Viral shedding in the stool begins about four to five weeks after infection and continues for up to four to five weeks [ 13, 14, 18– 20]. The start of the infectious period appears to approximately coincide with the onset of the prodromal phase of disease (i.e. early non-specific symptoms) [ 14].
